items.sentence: Tom bought two T-shirts, one for himself and one for Mary.
Tom said that he was from Boston, but I don't believe him.
Tom worked hard to make sure everything would go smoothly.
You know that they won't permit you to do that, don't you?
You know that I'm supposed to do that tomorrow, don't you?
You know that I have to go to Boston next week, don't you?
You knew I was the only one who could do that, didn't you?
I think this is something that Tom didn't want us to find.
Exaggeration is a billion times worse than understatement.
What counts is how effectively you use the time available.
The number of cars being driven in the city has increased.
Tom told me that I don't spend enough time with my family.
Is there anything else you'd like to share with the group?
Tom is apt to get angry if you ask him a lot of questions.
I had been up all night trying to finish the presentation.
Tom and Mary have something that they need to do tomorrow.
Tom stopped watching the movie because he found it boring.
I love you and I don't want anything bad to happen to you.
Was that Mary's actual voice or did she lip sync the song?
Tom was disciplined for behaving inappropriately in class.
